english: islet; small island; isle; used in place names

etymology.description: semantic: 山 + phonetic: 與 (→ 与)
etymology.interpretation: Mountain radical 山 signals a natural landform rising from the water, fitting the sense of an islet. The phonetic 與/与 contributes the reading yǔ, while meaning is determined by the semantic component.
etymology.simplification: The phonetic component 與 was simplified to 与 to reduce strokes while preserving the pronunciation; the semantic 山 remained unchanged.

examples.chinese: 海面上散落着几座小屿(海面上散落著幾座小嶼)。
examples.pinyin: Hǎimiàn shàng sànluòzhe jǐ zuò xiǎo yǔ.
examples.english: Several small islets are scattered across the sea.

examples.chinese: 渔民在近海的青屿避风(漁民在近海的青嶼避風)。
examples.pinyin: Yúmín zài jìnhǎi de Qīngyǔ bì fēng.
examples.english: Fishermen shelter from the wind at Qingyu, a nearshore islet.

examples.chinese: 屿上只有一座白色灯塔(嶼上只有一座白色燈塔)。
examples.pinyin: Yǔ shàng zhǐ yǒu yī zuò báisè dēngtǎ.
examples.english: There is only a white lighthouse on the islet.
